comments.body: Just a question: when do we set KUBE_XXXXX variables?
Usually before we run `e2e-up.sh` and `kube-up.sh`.
It's on my list to document the correct order for this. I don't know what else I will say, but I'm pretty sure initializers should go before this.
Discussed offline, we perhaps want to disallow mutating webhooks to change initializer list to begin with, so I'll keep the current order in this PR.

Ah, I wondered where that question came from.  I think having initializers last is reasonable, but I think we need to consider a case where a deployer thinks they have a better way to wire initializers.  In such a case, they should be able to disable the compiled in initializer plugin and provide their own via webhook.  I'd probably say that our initializer plugin will always zero the list and stomp it to whatever we want, but a user *could* disable it and provide their own if they wished.
Sent https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/55976.

comments.body:
@krousey @fejta can you verify this value from the [upgrade CI job env files](https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/search?q=E2E_UPGRADE_TEST) is visible in this scope?

Other values from those files (like [STORAGE_BACKEND](https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/search?q=STORAGE_BACKEND)) seem to be usable in this context, but I wanted to make sure

This value indicates that an upgrade step will run prior to a full e2e run. There are CI jobs that do upgrades that don't do this 2 pass behavior, so this will be unset for them.

Also, I'm not sure how closely we should tie the E2E* vars into this config. @fejta thoughts?

I am pretty sure e2e-runner.sh leaks this var, but this is not intentional. I plan to delete e2e-runner,.sh and its magical global state and replace it with flags that the job explicitly uses to call kubetest.

Could we solve this by adding `ENABLE_LEGACY_ABAC=false` to the .env file for the relevant upgrade jobs?
Ah. Adding `ENABLE_LEGACY_ABAC=true` in the upgrade jobs would drive the behavior directly
Opened https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/2330 to update upgrade jobs

comments.body:
the integration of support for replicasets into the cluster scripts seems incomplete when compared to something like daemonsets:

``` sh
$ find . -type f -exec grep -H -e DAEMONSET \{\} \;
./cluster/aws/config-default.sh:ENABLE_DAEMONSETS="${KUBE_ENABLE_DAEMONSETS:-}"
./cluster/aws/config-test.sh:ENABLE_DAEMONSETS="${KUBE_ENABLE_DAEMONSETS:-true}"
./cluster/common.sh:  if [[ "${ENABLE_DAEMONSETS}" == "true" ]]; then
./cluster/gce/config-default.sh:ENABLE_DAEMONSETS="${KUBE_ENABLE_DAEMONSETS:-}"
./cluster/gce/config-test.sh:ENABLE_DAEMONSETS="${KUBE_ENABLE_DAEMONSETS:-true}"
./cluster/kubemark/config-default.sh:ENABLE_DAEMONSETS="${KUBE_ENABLE_DAEMONSETS:-true}"
./hack/jenkins/e2e.sh:    KUBE_ENABLE_DAEMONSETS=true
./hack/jenkins/e2e.sh:    : ${KUBE_ENABLE_DAEMONSETS:=true}
./hack/jenkins/e2e.sh:    : ${KUBE_ENABLE_DAEMONSETS:=true}
./docs/admin/daemons.md:achieved by exporting KUBE_ENABLE_DAEMONSETS=true before running kube-up.sh script
```
hm .. is this because they're enabled by default?
Yes.
